name: mysql
description: This Dockerfile facilitates the setup of a MySQL container with port 3306 exposed. It utilizes the official MySQL base image and offers flexibility through customizable environment variables for configuration.

scripts.build-image: read -p 'Container Name: ' CONTAINER_NAME && docker build -t $CONTAINER_NAME . || podman build -t $CONTAINER_NAME .
scripts.run-container: read -p 'Container Name: ' CONTAINER_NAME && read -p 'MySQL Root Password: ' ROOT_PASSWORD && read -p 'MySQL User: ' USER && read -p 'MySQL Password: ' PASSWORD && docker run -p 3306:3306 --name $CONTAINER_NAME -e MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=$ROOT_PASSWORD -e MYSQL_USER=$USER -e MYSQL_PASSWORD=$PASSWORD -d $CONTAINER_NAME || podman run -p 3306:3306 --name $CONTAINER_NAME -e MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD=$ROOT_PASSWORD -e MYSQL_USER=$USER -e MYSQL_PASSWORD=$PASSWORD -d $CONTAINER_NAME
scripts.restart-container: read -p 'Container Name: ' CONTAINER_NAME && docker restart $CONTAINER_NAME || podman restart $CONTAINER_NAME
scripts.stop-container: read -p 'Container Name: ' CONTAINER_NAME && docker stop $CONTAINER_NAME || podman stop $CONTAINER_NAME
scripts.check-status: read -p 'Container Name: ' CONTAINER_NAME && docker ps | grep $CONTAINER_NAME || podman ps | grep $CONTAINER_NAME
scripts.check-all-status: read -p 'Container Name: ' CONTAINER_NAME && docker ps -a | grep $CONTAINER_NAME || podman ps -a | grep $CONTAINER_NAME
scripts.inspect-container: read -p 'Container Name: ' CONTAINER_NAME && docker inspect $CONTAINER_NAME || podman inspect $CONTAINER_NAME
scripts.get-connection-url: read -p 'Container Name: ' CONTAINER_NAME && docker inspect $CONTAINER_NAME | grep "IPAddress" | awk -F\" '{print $4}' | xargs echo mysql://$USER:$PASSWORD@
